importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, marking the most recent update in the ongoing 2025 MLB postseason.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The postseason is at a critical juncture, with the Dodgers and Blue Jays each one game away from advancing to the World Series, making this timeframe pivotal for the 2025 MLB championship race.

keyTakeAways: The Los Angeles Dodgers secured a 3-1 victory over the Milwaukee Brewers in Game 4 of the NLCS, moving them to a 3-0 series lead and placing them on track for a second consecutive World Series appearance.
The Dodgers are the first team since the Yankees in 2000 to achieve back-to-back World Series appearances, making their run historically significant.
The Toronto Blue Jays tied the Seattle Mariners in the ALCS after outscoring them 21-6 in Games 3 and 4, reviving their playoff hopes and giving them a series lead.
Max Scherzer delivered a strong performance with only two runs and three hits in 5 2/3 innings, while Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his fifth playoff home run.
The Blue Jays are now in a crucial position, with the series tied and a potential shift in momentum due to their offensive output.
The Dodgers have an 8-1 postseason record, with only a loss to the Phillies in the NLDS, showing resilience and consistency in their playoff run.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball (MLB) franchise in the National League.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are advancing in the postseason with a 3-0 lead in the NLCS, making them one of the most prominent teams in the 2025 MLB championship race.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An MLB team in the National League.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers are the opposing team in the NLCS, and the Dodgers' 3-0 lead makes them a key competitor in the series.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Phillies
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An MLB team in the National League.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Phillies were the last team to achieve back-to-back World Series appearances in 2009, providing historical context for the Dodgers' achievement.

namedEntities.name: Boston Red Sox
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An MLB team in the American League.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Red Sox are referenced as the only team to win a best-of-seven series after losing the first three games, which underscores the significance of the Dodgers' 3-0 lead.

namedEntities.name: New York Yankees
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An MLB team in the American League.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Yankees are cited as the last team to win three consecutive World Series between 1998 and 2000, setting a benchmark for back-to-back championship success.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An MLB team in the American League.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners are the opponents in the ALCS, currently trailing the Blue Jays after losing Games 3 and 4.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An MLB team in the American League.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays are now tied in the ALCS after a strong offensive showing in Games 3 and 4, putting them on the brink of advancing to the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Jacob Misiorowski
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He recorded a postseason record of nine strikeouts in a game, contributing to the tight nature of the NLCS game.

namedEntities.name: Tommy Edman
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He drove in a run with an RBI single in the sixth inning, helping the Dodgers take a 3-1 lead.

namedEntities.name: Freddie Freeman
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He scored on a throwing error from Abner Uribe, contributing to the Dodgers' 3-1 lead in the game.

namedEntities.name: Abner Uribe
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He committed a throwing error that allowed Freddie Freeman to score, a critical moment in the game.

namedEntities.name: Max Scherzer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 41-year-old pitcher for the Toronto Blue Jays.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He pitched effectively in Game 4 of the ALCS, allowing only two runs and three hits in 5 2/3 innings.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A player for the Toronto Blue Jays.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit his fifth playoff home run in the series, contributing to the Blue Jays' offensive surge.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Los Angeles Dodgers extend their lead in the National League Championship Series with a 3-1 win over the Milwaukee Brewers, moving to a 3-0 series lead and positioning themselves as the first team in 16 years to win back-to-back World Series appearances. Meanwhile, the Toronto Blue Jays overcome a 2-0 deficit in the American League Championship Series by outscoring the Seattle Mariners 21-6 in Games 3 and 4, tying the series and creating a pivotal moment in the postseason. Key performances from Dodgers players like Tommy Edman and Freddie Freeman and Blue Jays pitcher Max Scherzer and hitter Vladimir Guerrero Jr. highlight the competitive momentum. With both teams now in a position to reach the World Series, the 2025 MLB postseason is at a critical juncture.
title: Dodgers close in on second straight World Series appearance, Blue Jays knot up ALCS against Mariners
